videos.title: Episode 49: Good God in a Bad World
videos.description:

videos.title: Episode 50: Let's Talk about the International Conference on Creationism
videos.description:
Since 1986, the International Conference on Creationism (ICC) has been a place for creationists to meet together and present their latest work. This episode celebrates the 37th year of ICC. Though it only meets every 5 years, past conferences have seen some of the most important creation research ever presented. Paul and Todd and special guests Dr. Bob Walsh, Dr. John Whitmore and Dr. Steve Gollmer share favorite papers and how they influenced their work. They also discuss what they are looking forward to seeing this year.

For more information about the International Conference on Creationism please visit: https://www.internationalconferenceoncreationism.com/


Guests: 
Bob Walsh, Creation Science Fellowship of Pittsburgh. Dr. Walsh is one of the founders of the ICC and part of the Creation Science Fellowship which is the organization that founded and hosted the ICC 8 times. https://csfpittsburgh.org/

John Whitmore, Cedarville University. Dr. Whitmore served as editor for the last ICC and is also serving as the Editor for the ICC this year.  
https://www.cedarville.edu/academic-schools-and-departments/science-and-mathematics/international-conference-creationism

Steve Gollmer, Cedarville University. Dr. Gollmer is serving on the editorial committee and is the secretary of the ICC this year.

videos.title: Episode 51: Humans walked with Dinosaurs?
videos.description:
Are the Paluxy footprints in Glen Rose, Texas evidence of humans and dinosaurs living together, a hoax, or a case of mistaken identity?  Todd and Paul discuss the history of the world-famous dinosaur tracks found in Texas limestone and how they’ve been interpreted and re-interpreted over the history of creationism in the twentieth century.

Resources Mentioned in the Podcast

Jens N. Lallensak, James O. Farlow, Peter Falkingham. 2021. A new solution to an old riddle: elongate dinosaur tracks explained as deep penetration of the foot, not plantigrade locomotion. Palaeontology  65: 1 https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/pala.12584

videos.title: Episode 52: Why Would God Make Parasites?
videos.description:
With Special Guest Dr. Jeremy Blaschke, Assistant Professor of Science at Union University, Todd and Paul discuss the wonders of the parasite world. What we see as gross and disgusting are possibly beautiful from God’s point of view. Todd and Paul learn about how some creatures thought to be parasites can be beneficial to their hosts. 

Special Guest
Dr. Jeremy Blaschke is an Assistant Professor of Science at Union University in Jackson, TN. He is an entomologist who studies parasitoid wasps and other parasites found in God’s creation. He has several publications and enjoys supervising undergraduate research projects.
https://www.uu.edu/dept/biology/faculty/jeremy-blaschke.cfm

Jeremy Blashke. 2022 Parasite Soup: Faith and Science in the History of Parasitology.  Zygon. https://doi.org/10.1111/zygo.12770

videos.title: Episode 53: What, in the world, are Behemoth and Leviathan???
videos.description:
In the Book of Job, the creatures Behemoth and Leviathan are mentioned. Some people have interpreted these creatures as purely mythological. Others, have equated them with modern or extinct creatures. Todd and Paul address a listener's request to weigh in on the discussion. What were Behemoth and Leviathan?  Also, our new website https://letstalkcreation.org/ is launched.

Resources mentioned in the podcast:
Please note that none of the resources mentioned below reflect Todd and Paul’s views.


Dinosaurs: Those Terrible Lizards by Duane T. Gish is an older creationist book that discusses Behemoth and Leviathan

God's Conflict with the Dragon and the Sea by John Day is a higher criticism book that talks about the mythological view of the behemoth and leviathan.

The Ugaritic Tablets-tablets found north of Israel with many stories of myths and legends of the Canaanites.

HG Wells- The Undying Fire- modern story that refers to extinct creatures as behemoths and leviathans. 

Taming the Beast by Mark Sneed. Gives the history of interpretation throughout church history. He also takes a mythological view of the behemoth and leviathan.
https://www.amazon.com/Taming-Beast-Reception-Behemoth-Leviathan/dp/3110579316

videos.title: Episode 54: Genesis Genealogies: Calculating the Age of Creation
videos.description:
The world began in 4004 BC, or that is what Bishop Ussher believed. How do we know? Join Todd and Paul as they begin a series on the genealogies of Genesis and how they calculate the age of the Earth. Also, check out our new website at https://letstalkcreation.org/

Resources Mentioned in the Podcast

In 1890, a famous Princeton professor named William Henry Green wrote an article called “Primeval Chronology,” wherein he surveyed all the genealogies of the Bible and tried to draw some conclusions. 
http://toddcwood.blogspot.com/2016/10/the-primeval-chronology-of-william.html

Weld-Blundell Prism
 The Sumerian Kings List, fragmentary clay tablets using a form of writing called cuneiform.  There’s only one mostly complete copy of this record that today is in the Ashmolean Museum in Oxford
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weld-Blundell_Prism
https://www.ashmolean.org/sumerian-king-list

Hippolytus of Rome Chronicon
Early Church Father who was concerned with using the genealogies of the Bible to construct a biblical chronology.
https://amzn.to/3Feg7V7
http://toddcwood.blogspot.com/2017/12/hippolytus-of-rome.html

videos.title: Episode 55: Which rocks are Flood Rocks? Part 1: Introduction
videos.description:
If the Flood was a global disaster that made new rock layers, which rock layers were made by the Flood?  This is a question that has occupied the minds of Christians for centuries, well before the modern creationist movement.  In this episode, Todd and Paul introduce us to the history of Flood geology and the quest to identify the Flood in the fossil record.


Resources Mentioned in the Podcast

The Great Turning Point by Terry Mortenson 2004 - This book discusses the early days of geology and the rise of the scriptural geologists

Scriptural Geology by George Bugg 1826 – This is the book that gave the scriptural geologists their name.

A Comparative Estimate of the Mineral and Mosaical Geologies by Granville Penn 1822 

General View of the Geology of Scripture by George Fairholme (1833)

Episode 6 The Geologic Column for Beginners https://youtu.be/yfq1wje8uzI
Episode 7 The Geologic Column for Beginners Part 2 https://youtu.be/wHHp9B762wk

Warren Johns, Scriptural Geology, Then and Now, ARJ 9:317-337. https://assets.answersingenesis.org/doc/articles/pdf-versions/arj/v9/scriptural_geology.pdf

The New Geology by George McCready Price 1923. Price’s book stating that there is not a pattern to geology.

Works of Sir Henry Howorth
• H.H. Howorth, The Mammoth and the Flood (1887), https://catalog.hathitrust.org/Record/001488368

• H.H. Howorth, The Glacial Nightmare (1893),
https://archive.org/details/glacialnightmare01howorich

• H.H. Howorth, Ice or Water? (1905). https://www.amazon.com/Ice-Water-Another-Induction-Scholastic/dp/114282649X

These books written against the ideas of Charles Lyell influenced George McCready Price

The New Diluvialism  by Harold Clark 1946. Book written by Clark to describe his ecological zonation model of Flood Geology and state that there is a pattern to the geologic column.

Theories of Satanic Origin by George McCready Price 1947. A pamphlet written to refute Clark’s model of Flood Geology

Whitmore, John H. and Garner, Paul (2008) "Using Suites of Criteria to Recognize Pre-Flood, Flood, and Post-Flood Strata in the Rock Record with Application to Wyoming (USA)," Proceedings of the International Conference on Creationism: Vol. 6, Article 35.
Available at: https://digitalcommons.cedarville.edu/icc_proceedings/vol6/iss1/35

videos.title: Episode 58: Which rocks are Flood Rocks? Part 4: Parting Thoughts
videos.description:
EPISODE 58: Which Rocks are Flood Rocks Part 4: Parting Thoughts
Join Paul and Todd as they wrap up their four-part series on the Flood boundary.  Todd recaps previous episodes in the series, and Paul gives his perspective from his own research.  As creationists work to better understand the fossil record, Todd and Paul encourage humility and kindness to work through disagreements.

Resources Mentioned in the Podcast

Below is a picture of a conventional geologic column to indicate where the proposed boundaries are located. The K-Pg is between the Cretaceous and the Tertiary (Paleogene). The Cenozoic rocks are the ones that are most in dispute when discussing the Flood/post-Flood Boundary

videos.title: Episode 61: Behind the Scenes of Is Genesis History: Mountains after the Flood with Thomas Purifoy
videos.description:
Todd and Paul chat with producer Thomas Purifoy about his new film Is Genesis History: Mountains after the Flood. Thomas explains the surprising birth of the film and his passion for explaining how creation science actually works. The film follows geologists Andrew Snelling and John Whitmore as they study the remarkable folded layers in the Grand Canyon. Their research takes them from the bottom of the canyon to the tops of the Rocky Mountains, and Thomas's cameras follow them all the way. Get the whole story on this episode of Let's Talk Creation!
Visit our website at https://letstalkcreation.org/

Our Guest:
Thomas Purifoy is the producer, writer, and director of both Is Genesis History and the sequel Is Genesis History: Mountains After the Flood.  He is the founder of Compass Cinema and Compass Classroom which creates and distributes curricula for homeschool families.  He is a strong supporter of young-earth creation scientists and is responsible for starting the New Creation Blog.

videos.title: Episode 73: Giant Cannibal Babies!  What were the Nephilim?
videos.description: Paul and Todd revisit the fascinating subject of the Nephilim in Genesis 6.  Who were they?  Were they children of fallen angels?  Were they giant cannibal babies that ate everything in sight?  Were they aliens with advanced alien technology?  In this episode we'll explore all of these questions and more, as we examine biblical and nonbiblical references to the Nephilim and their place in modern pop culture.

videos.title: Episode 74: A Christmas Reading List
videos.description:

They've narrowed their big libraries down to just a few books they think every creationist should read, on subjects ranging from hard science to Christian living. If you're still looking for a last-minute (or late) Christmas gift, or if you're looking for an interesting book to read, they've got just the list!

videos.title: Episode 75: Russ Humphreys and the Extra Helium (RATE Project)
videos.description:
Paul and Todd return to their radiometric dating series with this interview with Russ Humphreys, who was part of the original RATE project. Dr. Humphreys describes his study of helium, an element produced when radioactive elements break down. What clues will helium give us about the age of the earth? Find out in this episode!

videos.title: Episode 78: Think before You Meme!
videos.description:
In this episode, Paul takes Todd on a surprise tour of creation/evolution memes, those little pictures and captions that get shared around social media. Watch Paul share memes from the mildly benign to the awkwardly wrong-headed, while Todd squirms the entire time! How should Christians interact with social media? Is it a good idea to share memes on the internet? How can we avoid making the problem worse (hint: just don't share memes!). Find out in this episode of "Let's Talk Creation!"

videos.title: Episode 79: Creationism 101: In the Beginning
videos.description:
Come along on this special episode as Paul and Todd go "back to basics" to explain the most fundamental questions of creationism. They explain reasons from the Bible and theology why young age creationists read the Bible the way they do. From Paul's discussion of the last Adam to Peter's discussion of the Flood to Jesus' citation of the blood of Abel, Paul and Todd explain a nuanced and thoughtful approach to reading Genesis 1-11 that is far beyond just "literalism."

videos.title: Episode 82: A LOCAL flood?  Responding to Gavin Ortlund
videos.description:
Apologist Gavin Ortlund is one of many who have suggested that maybe the Flood wasn't a global catastrophe after all.  Maybe it was just a regional catastrophe that destroyed all the people alive at the time?  Paul and Todd look at the evidence for the Flood's universality and how well the local flood model explains the evidence it claims to explain.  Does the local flood hold water?  Or is it all washed up?  Find out in this episode!

videos.title: Episode 83: Creationism 101: Creation Week
videos.description:
What is this creation week in Genesis 1? Lots of scholars have lots of strong opinions on this question. In this episode, Paul and Todd summarize the young age creationist view of Genesis 1 as the first week of time. Along the way, they explain how we know the days are just 24 hours, how we have days without the sun, and how the order of creation does not match the fossil record. Check this whole series out for a basic introduction to young age creationist thought.

videos.title: Episode 87: Erosion Shows the Earth is Young! featuring Monte Fleming
videos.description:
"Solid" ground under our feet is gradually slipping away as the oceans of the world relentlessly erode the coastlines.  It might surprise you to discover just how fast that's happening!  In this episode, special guest Monte Fleming explains the evidence of coastal erosion that indicates the continents couldn't be much more than a few million years old, just a tiny fraction of the billions of years they're supposed to be according to conventional radiometric dating.  Join Todd and Paul for this fascinating chat as they explore the true age of the continents!

videos.title: Episode 94: Hans Madueme DEFENDING SIN! Part 2
videos.description:
Hans Madueme is back for round two as Paul and Todd continue their conversation over his book Defending Sin. In this episode, they get down to really deep issues as they wrestle with the actual relationship of science and faith. How do believers go about reconciling what they see in science and in Scripture? Is there a right way? What do our anxieties have to do with this? Struggling through these issues lead the guys to chat about being creationists in a pluralistic church, where different people believe different things. If our most important goal is following Jesus, what does that look like when our personal beliefs are so very different from someone else's? We hope you enjoy the conversation as Todd and Paul wrap up their interview with Hans Madueme in this episode!

videos.title: EPISODE 100: Creation Together with Darrel Falk!
videos.description:
Paul and Todd celebrate their 100th episode with special guest Darrel Falk!  Darrel believes that God used the evolutionary process to create the world, and he and Todd have been talking about their differences for more than a decade now.  You undoubtedly know all about the arrogant and scornful way that creationists and evolutionists typically interact, but what if there was a better way?  Todd and Darrel disagree about science and evolution, but they are one in Christ.  In this episode, witness a pattern for a different kind of disagreement.

This episode was originally recorded live at Trinity Chapel in Dayton, TN on July 18, 2024.

videos.title: Episode 104: The Immune System with Joe Francis
videos.description:
If creation was originally free of disease and suffering, why do we have such an immune system? Our defense against dangerous germs is intricate, elaborate, and effective, and clearly it was part of God's design for our bodies. So what was the point? Paul and Todd are joined by creation immunologist Joe Francis to discuss the wonders of the immune system, how much of a blessing it really is, and what more it does for us than just police our bodies for germs. This episode is part of our intermittent series on natural evil.

Books and Papers Mentioned in this Episode

Francis, J.W., M. Ingle, and T.C. Wood. 2018. Bacteriophages as beneficial regulators of the mammalian microbiome. In Proceedings of the Eighth International Conference on Creationism, ed. J.H. Whitmore, pp. 152–157. Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania: Creation Science Fellowship.
https://doi.org/10.15385/jpicc.2018.8.1.16

Francis, Joseph W. and Wood, Todd C. (2013) "A Creationist Perspective on the Origin of Pathogenic Vibrio Cholerae and Vibrio Cholerae Toxin (CT)," Proceedings of the International Conference on Creationism: Vol. 7, Article 29.
https://digitalcommons.cedarville.edu/icc_proceedings/vol7/iss1/29

Francis, Joseph W. (2003) "The Organosubstrate of Life: A Creationist Perspective of Microbes and Viruses," Proceedings of the International Conference on Creationism: Vol. 5, Article 40.
https://digitalcommons.cedarville.edu/icc_proceedings/vol5/iss1/40

videos.title: Episode 105: Cambridge House
videos.description:
Paul and Todd welcome Stephen Lloyd back to the show to talk about the Cambridge House project.  This past year, Biblical Creation Trust launched a student ministry in downtown Cambridge with the goal of building a residential study center to help train a new generation of thoughtful creation researchers.  In this episode, Paul and Stephen discuss the vision of Cambridge House, their current status, and what it will take to make it a reality.  To find out more about Biblical Creation Trust and their Cambridge House project, visit their website at https://biblicalcreationtrust.org/ch.html

videos.title: Episode 106: Does God care about animals?
videos.description:
In this fascinating episode, Paul and Todd resume their discussion of natural evil with special guest Dr. Rahel Wells. If the world we live in is the same way God made it in the beginning, what does this tell us about God's care for the animals? On the other hand, if God really does care for the animals, how might that care shape our view of creation? Dr. Wells walks us through scripture's teaching about animals and explains what we should do about it. This is a unique conversation you won't want to miss!

Books and Papers Mentioned in this Episode

Henning Steinfeld; Pierre Gerber; Tom Wassenaar; Vincent Castel; Mauricio Rosales; Cees de Haan (2006). Livestock's long shadow.

videos.title: Episode 107: A Crack in the Crust?? with Ryan Thompson
videos.description:
The entire surface of the earth is broken up into pieces bounded by massive cracks called faults.  Join Todd and Paul as they chat with geologist Ryan Thompson about these massive cracks and how they relate to earthquakes, the Flood, and even the Holy Land!  Why does the Jordan River flow where it does?  Find out on this episode of Let's Talk Creation

videos.title: Episode 108: What is the Creation Research Society? with Joel Brown
videos.description:
Join Paul and Todd as they chat with Joel Brown, the director of the Van Andel Creation Research Center at Arizona Christian University in Phoenix, Arizona. With a PhD in genetics, Joel became a high school teacher in St Louis and then felt led to take on the leadership of the VACRC, the historic research lab of the Creation Research Society. How does the center work? What are they working on? And how can we be involved? Find out in this new episode!
